snippet: The company said it disagreed that 2.7 million Jeep models posed a danger of fire in rear-impact accidents.
abstract: Chrysler says it will not recall 2.7 million Jeeps government contends are defective and prone to fires in event of rear-impact collisions; it is unusual for car companies to refuse recall requests made by National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, which regulates safety of vehicles, but Chrysler says it does not agree vehicles, among its most profitable models, are unsafe.
lead_paragraph: The company said it disagreed that 2.7 million Jeep models posed a danger of fire in rear-impact accidents.

headline.seo: In a Rare Rebuff, Chrysler Rejects Regulator’s Request to Recall Jeeps
headline.main: Chrysler Rejects Regulator’s Request to Recall Jeeps
headline.print_headline: Chrysler Rejects Regulator’s Request to Recall Jeeps
